name: MSI Electric City
description: MSI Electric City is a virtual reality sci-fi seated experience where you are transported to a futuristic city never seen before. Discover magnificent scenery and soar through wondrous architectures.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7  (64 bit) Processor: Intel i5-4590 Memory: 8 GB RAM Graphics: GTX 970 DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 3 GB available space Sound Card: Windows Compatible Sound Card

reviews.review_text: A fun way to advertize. An under 5 minute fly through a motherboard (envisioned as a city), with each component labeled along the way. No controls, just sit back and enjoy the view.  As much as I normally hate ads, if more companies made advertizing-based experiences like this, I'd probably be willing to watch them!
A nice little interaction-less thrill ride (leading to a motherboard advert at the end) Having to start it with a keyboard is a ballache if your keyboard is nowhere near your VR gear though.
Very neat way of advertising. Hopefully this format is the future. Really nice demo, good music, thrilling rollercoaster vibe. Now just turn this into a game.

Played on ultra on my gtx 1080 so I had the premium experiance. It was awesome, very immersive, superb graphics and clarity, like a universal ride. And its free, I would have paid a couple bucks for this Exp.
Great idea. poorly executed. next time just spend a bit more time and money
